Package com.skloch.game

package com.skloch.game
  • Related Packages
    Package
    Description
    com.skloch.game.events
     
    com.skloch.game.interfaces
     
    com.skloch.game.mocks
     
    com.skloch.game.tests
     
  • Classes
    Class
    Description
    Achievement
    Represents an achievement in the game.
    CreditScreen
    A scene window consisting of a title, a scrollable widget and an exit button.
    DesktopLauncher
    DesktopLauncher class to launch the Heslington Hustle game.
    DialogueBox
    A class to display a dialogue box for text and options on the screen.
    EventManager
    A class that maps Object's event strings to actual Java functions.
    GameLogic
    A class that handles the game logic, including the player, time, energy, and map switching.
    GameMap
    Represents the game map.
    GameObject
    An object that stores a position and dimensions, but can also store extra properties when loaded from a tile map.
    GameOverScreen
    A screen that displays the player's stats at the end of the game.
    GameRenderer
    A class to render the game, including the player, map and UI elements.
    GameScreen
    Handles the majority of the game logic, rendering and user inputs of the game.
    GameUi
    A class to display the game's user interface, including the energy bar, time, stats, and dialogue box.
    HustleGame
    A class that is initially created by DesktopLauncher, loads consistent files at the start of the game and initialises lots of important classes.
    MenuScreen
    A screen to display the game menu to the player has the buttons "Start", "Settings", "Credits, "Exit" ALso displays a tutorial window and an avatar select screen.
    OptionDialogue
    Deprecated.
    Creates a small window to receive a yes/no response from the player No longer used, but the code may still be useful.
    PlayerInterface
    A class handling everything needed to control and draw a player, including animation, movement and collision.
    SettingsScreen
    A screen to display settings to the player, lets the player adjust sound and music volume.
    SoundManager
    A class handling loading, playing and disposing of sounds.
